dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You... you need to go to the police.

dialogue.speaker: MRS CHRISTIAN
dialogue.text: I told you I can't, not yet.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You don't have any other choice.

dialogue.speaker: MRS CHRISTIAN
dialogue.text: No.  For me to live with the ruin of my husband's name, I need know that whoever did this will be punished. If you can find them, I will take their names to the police.  I'll say my husband confessed on his death bed. I'll say I didn't have courage to come forward at first...

dialogue.speaker: MRS CHRISTIAN
dialogue.text: Any evidence you collect can be given to the police later, anonymously.  I've thought about it and there's no other way.  If you can't find them... if the only thing that comes from this film is that this is all my husband will be remembered for, well I can't let that happen.  I'm telling you I won't.  If there's no chance that poor girl's memory can be served, then I'll just have to spend my last days trying to forget her.
